alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 28 at 2:23AM MST until January 30 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...A prolonged period of light to moderate snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with locally higher amounts possible. Areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Lower elevations of Carbon and Albany counties including Rawlins, Muddy Gap, Shirley Basin, Baggs, and the central Laramie, Ferris, Seminoe, and Shirley Mountains. The highest totals will be found near higher ridgetops. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Monday. A brief lull in snowfall is possible Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
